title: ci: update gitignore
body: To avoid `cargo publish` warning us that we have untracked files in our working directory.

title: ci: fixup config for publish workflow
chore: make image urls in readme absolute
body:
Currently, the images only render when the readme is displayed on github - they're broken on other sites such as crates.io:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12255914/109983758-0821cb00-7cfb-11eb-9696-5a615059e944.png)

title: ci: add crate publish workflow
body: Before use, the `CARGO_LOGIN_TOKEN` secret should be set in the repo settings to an appropriate value.

title: ci: cache cargo binary installations
body: For `cargo-audit` and `cargo-tarpaulin` (which still take a long time to install)

title: examples: update screenshots, changelog, docs
body:
As the current screenshots are out of date, take and upload new ones, and replace the downstream references.

Also clarify the changlog stating the diff output format has changed with a visual example.

title: ci: add github actions
body:
For #46 

Travis CI appears to be:
- migrating users to some sort of quota/credit based plan
- having technical difficulties during their migration to travis-ci.com

Currently builds are experiencing enough problems on Travis that porting them to Github is less effort.

title: chore: move tests around and restructure
body:
Moves the external files from `tests` back into `test` modules within the library, as there are testing internal library functionality. In general, test suites in `tests` should be reserved for integration tests.

I also took the opportunity to simplify the test data - the test data checking the macro behaviour (invocation/panic) doesn't contain complex formatting examples any more. These have been moved back to internal unit tests, where test data with complex escape sequences doesn't have to be written manually.

title: ci: clear cargo audit ignores
body: Ref #44; now we no longer depend on `difference`, we can stop ignoring the `cargo audit` warning for it.

title: internal: replace difference with diff
body:
For #44 

This PR replaces the internal use of `difference` with the [`diff`](https://crates.io/crates/diff) library, which is well used and tested.

While the library has not been updated in over a year, the maintainer is still very active online and has [stated the lack of updates is just that they don't have any more features to add](https://github.com/utkarshkukreti/diff.rs/issues/14#issuecomment-566096896).

The current [benchmark suite](https://github.com/tommilligan/rust-pretty-assertions-bench) shows this branch as equal to or slightly more performant than `main`. This is significantly better than an alternative implementation using `similar` (#51).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12255914/107856364-92bf8a80-6e1f-11eb-9641-8ae3560f4bd5.png)

title: Test and fix macro hygiene
body:
Closes #41

Some macro expansions were not hygenic, and ended up referencing the standard library `assert_eq` and `assert_ne`. This was masked in tests by statements such as `use pretty_assertions::assert_eq` which masked the stdlib macros in tests.

Updated tests to remove these `use` statements, and audited the existing macro code for non-`$crate` qualified paths.

title: ci: make travis fail on audit failure
body:
For #46 

- make sure the build fails correctly if any check fails
- ignore the existing `difference` audit warning
- break out installation and checking as scripts

title: ci: test windows, enforce clippy
body:
For #46 

Includes some minor touches to the code keep clippy happy.
